question_sentence: Friedrich Merz visited France and which other country on his first full day as German chancellor?
evidence: Merz's premiership got off to a shaky start on Tuesday when he became the first postwar chancellor-delegate not to receive the necessary number of votes in the Bundestag to be confirmed in the role. Following a behind-the-scenes scramble, he finally passed the threshold in a second round of voting.

question_sentence: Which messaging app used by members of the Trump administration was hacked and suspended?
evidence: Former National Security Adviser Mike Waltz has found himself in another scandal after being photographed using the messaging app TeleMessage, which was later hacked, causing concern among national security experts. The hacker stole data from high-level Trump administration officials, leading to the suspension of the app's services.

question_sentence: Which Chinese snooker star became the first Asian player to win the sport's World Championship?
evidence: The 28-year-old's triumph should have been a moment of glory for Chinese snooker, but it came under the shadow of Zhao's 20-month suspension for his role in a match-fixing scandal. Zhao, who was not accused of directly participating in match-fixing, beat Welsh champion Mark Williams 18-12 at the Crucible in Sheffield on Monday.

question_sentence: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif referred to India's missile strikes on Pakistan as what?
evidence: India launched missile strikes on nine sites in Pakistan, killing 26 people and drawing retaliatory fire. Pakistan's prime minister described the attack as an "act of war", while India claimed it targeted "terrorist infrastructure".

question_sentence: Donald Trump's vow to reopen Alcatraz came hours after a TV broadcast of which movie about the infamous prison?
evidence: In a post on Truth Social, Donald Trump declared that he would reopen the island prison, which closed its doors in 1963, to "serve as a symbol of Law, Order, and JUSTICE". Eagle-eyed observers noticed that Florida TV station WLRN, which broadcasts in the area around the president's Mar-a-Lago residence, had shown the 1979 Clint Eastwood classic just a few hours before the announcement.

question_sentence: Why was the US ambassador summoned by the Danish government?
choices: Reports of US spying in Greenland
For posting hate speech on X
For calling for a military invasion
evidence: Following a "somewhat disturbing" report in The Wall Street Journal that the Trump administration instructed US intelligence agencies to increase surveillance on Greenland's independence movement, Danish Foreign Minister Lars Løkke Rasmussen said he would summon the acting US ambassador, stating: "We do not spy on friends."

question_sentence: Which beloved star celebrated their 99th birthday and the release of their latest film in the same week?
evidence: The British broadcasting icon's latest project, "Ocean", was released in UK cinemas on his birthday. Toby Nowlan, one of the directors, said that the film – in which Attenborough calls for a halt to the destruction caused by industrial over-fishing – represents the "biggest message he's ever told".

question_sentence: Which US drug store chain has filed for bankruptcy?
evidence: The drug store chain has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy for the second time in under two years. It will keep stores open during the process, hoping that the protection bankruptcy offers will help it find a new buyer.

question_sentence: According to a new poll, who is the most popular living member of the British royal family in the US?
evidence: The heir to the throne emerged as the most well-liked living royal in a poll of 1,296 US adults, with 63% of respondents saying they had a positive impression of him, compared to 56% who said the same of Prince Harry. The most popular royals of all were Diana, Princess of Wales and Queen Elizabeth, liked by 79% and 73% of respondents respectively.

question_sentence: The newly elected Pope Leo XIV hails from which US state?
evidence: Pope Francis' successor, Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost, was born and raised in Chicago, Illinois. Pope Leo, 69, is the first American pontiff in the Catholic Church's 2,000-year history.

question_sentence: Which political figure was recently given the John F. Kennedy Profile in Courage Award?
evidence: Pence received the award for refusing to overturn the results of the 2020 election.

question_sentence: A 70-year-old man was charged with stalking and vandalism after allegedly crashing into the front gate of a Bel Air home owned by which celebrity?
evidence: Aniston was reportedly home when the incident occurred.

question_sentence: SharkNinja announced a massive recall of which type of appliance this week due to reports of burn injuries?
evidence: SharkNinja recalled nearly 2 million multi-function pressure cookers and warned consumers to “immediately stop using the product’s pressure-cooking function.”

question_sentence: Which automaker announced it plans to hike sticker prices for three models it imports from Mexico due to Trump’s tariffs?
evidence: Ford is raising prices for the Mustang Mach-E, the Maverick and the Bronco Sport by up to $2,000 each.

question_sentence: President Trump announced plans to reopen which notorious prison to “house America’s most ruthless and violent offenders.”
evidence: Trump said he is directing the Bureau of Prisons to rebuild and reopen Alcatraz.

question_sentence: The release of which highly anticipated video game has been delayed until May 2026?
evidence: Fans have been waiting for “Grand Theft Auto VI” for over a decade, and analysts expect it to be an instant hit.

question_sentence: President Trump held a somewhat contentious meeting this week with the leader of which country?
evidence: Trump hosted Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney at the White House amid historic tensions between both countries.

question_sentence: Police in Rio de Janeiro recently foiled a possible attack on a concert featuring which music superstar?
evidence: Authorities in Brazil said two people attempted to “recruit” fans to carry out attacks at the Lady Gaga concert using IEDs and Molotov cocktails.

question_sentence: Some of the actors in which hit musical may bow out of a performance for President Trump at the Kennedy Center?
evidence: At least 10 to 12 performers in “Les Misérables” are planning to sit out the show next month.

question_sentence: Which new category will be added to the Golden Globes in 2026?
evidence: The new category will honor the “extraordinary and diverse talents in podcasting.”
